column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I was in Chicago for the first time
column2: so of course I had to check out the famous Lou Malnati's - it did not disappoint! I went on a weekday a little before noon and thought it was odd that there was barely anyone in the restaurant. However
column4: the restaurant was completely full and a line had formed. I've never been a huge fan of deep dish pizza
column5: mainly because the crust is always too dense. While the crust on this pizza was indeed thick like traditional deep dish
column8: and absolutely delicious. The toppings were also fresh and generously distributed. Lou Malnati's made me realize I actually do like deep dish pizza and I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago.
